column4: I have an HP laptop that comes with touch sensitive music control buttons built in. They've been working fine, but now they're not. I've checked hardware drivers, and there's nothing there for this. How can I make them work again?
You might want to google "ubuntu community, HP <your model>" to see if there are anything about it.  Usually, there are pages dedicated to popular models.
Also, there are multimedia keys, but I'm not sure if that applies to you too.  Worth something to read.
The touch keys always used to work before though.
What would have happened to cause them to stop working? The only one that works is volume, and only the up/down. Mute doesn't work.
I don't really know.  Certain changes in updates is possible.
Did you check/find your HP page?
Just updated a day ago, and that's when the problem started...so I'm gonna guess it was updates. anyway to do like a restore?
Google search is looking pretty bland, no?
Another suggestion -- Come back at later time when somebody more knowledge is here and may help you with your issue or make a new thread and post your issue on Ubuntu Forum.
I've tried the Ubuntu forums many times. The only thing I get is other's posting their problems in my threads, and then my thread getting ignored after 3 days
I'll have to come back later then. Thanks for the help
